titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Resident, Bushire, to the Honourable Mountstuart Elphinstone, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter, William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, reports the loss of the Honourable Company cruiser Ariel,which foundered in a squall about fifteen miles south east of Karrack [Jazīreh-ye Khārk], on its way from Bussora [Basra] to Bushire, on the morning of 18 March 1820. Bruce states that only five of eighty-three men on board survived. These five survivors made it to Karrack in a canoe, where the Shaik [Shaikh] provided them with a boat in which to travel to Bushire. Bruce relays details of the Ariel'sfate and states that the survivors will proceed to the Presidency by the first ship that is going there.
